alert.note: Alert for Delano-Wasco-Shafter; South End Sierra Foothills; South End of the Lower Sierra; Southeast San Joaquin Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 8:59PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Kern and southern Tulare Counties through 930 PM PDT... At 857 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles southeast of Ducor, or 21 miles northeast of Bakersfield, moving west at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Delano, Wasco, McFarland, Richgrove and Famoso. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Delano-Wasco-Shafter; South End Sierra Foothills; South End of the Lower Sierra; Southeast San Joaquin Valley
